weaveJ

Programmatic aspect weaver for Java.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
es.uniovi.reflection.test
Classes necessary to run unit tests.
es.uniovi.reflection.test.aspects
Example aspect classes to use in the unit tests.
es.uniovi.reflection.test.component
Classes containing the specific unit tests to verify the correctness of the system.
es.uniovi.reflection.util
Internal util classes used by the code generation package.
es.uniovi.reflection.weaver
Classes necessary to run the weaver.
es.uniovi.reflection.weaver.dynamicGeneration
Classes necessary to create dynamically generated classes.
es.uniovi.reflection.weaver.java7
Classes necessary to instrument applications and transform application classes at load time when using java7.
es.uniovi.reflection.weaver.javaAgent
Classes necessary to instrument applications at load time.
es.uniovi.reflection.weaver.methods
Classes necessary to model all the different joinpoints supported by weaveJ.
Programmatic aspect weaver for Java.

To use weaveJ in Java:
  1. Download java-agent.jar from source-code\lib folder, and add it to your system classpath.
  2. Employ the API in your code to declare and use pointcuts, using the static class es.uniovi.reflection.weaver.Weaver.
  3. Specify the following arguments to the VM :
    • The java agent:
      -javaagent:[path_to_the_jar]/java-agent.jar.
    • The classes or packages to be instrumented:
      -Dformatting=[packages_or_classes_you_want_instrument] (';' as separator)
Notice: weaveJ works with Java 8. The setField joinpoint is only supported for non-final fields.
Version:
1.1.0
Author:
Oscar Rodriguez-Prieto Date: 2017/07/11
